description: To the rear of the property- lower ground floor rear terrace, the raising of the front wall of the existing lower ground floor projection, ground floor rear extension, rooflights and changes to the fenestration.  To the front of the property- new window above front entrance door, steps within the light well to lower ground floor level, new access gate, replacement of side door within lightwell and glazed canopy over door to basement [Listed Building Consent application P2013/0744/LBC also submitted].
decision_conditions: The proposed extensions and alterations by reason of their size, form and location, would be over dominant and incongruous and would harm the appearance of the dwelling, the character and appearance of the conservation area and the setting of the listed building, contrary to policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2011), policies D4 (Designing in Context), D11 (Alterations and Extensions) and D28 of Islington's Unitary Development Plan (2002), policies CS8 and CS9 of Islington's Core Strategy (2011) and emerging policies DM1 and DM3 of the Development Management Policies (Submission Version 2012) and guidance contained within the Islington's Urban Design Guide (2006) and the Barnsbury Conservation Area Design Guidelines.
